snippet: Google maintained its right to document residential streets with its Street View technology, but it must blur out sensitive facilities and notify communities in advance.
abstract: Switzerland's highest court upholds Google's basic right to document residential street fronts with its Street View technology, but imposes some limitations on the kinds of images the company can take; ruling leaves the service legally intact in Switzerland, which has some of the strictest privacy safeguards in the world.

byline.original: By KEVIN J. O'BRIEN and DAVID STREITFELD

lead_paragraph: Google maintained its right to document residential streets with its Street View technology, but it must blur out sensitive facilities and notify communities in advance.

headline.seo: Swiss Court Orders Modifications to Google Street View
headline.main: Swiss Court Orders Modifications to Google Street View
headline.print_headline: Swiss Court Allows Google Street View
